website_summaries.verdict: Progressive is the theme of the Adidas CodeChaos BOA, and it reflects on both of its style and features. The shoe easily stands out on the course. The high-top built combined with the BOA lacing system are the features that excelled for golfers. Besides that, necessary qualities like comfort, stability, and grip remain to be present for this version.
pros: Comfort is a must for those who purchased the Adidas CodeChaos BOA, and they are delighted that the shoe provides it
The fresh look is highly appreciated by many
It stands out, and people are quick to notice it
The inner sock construction and the BOA lacing system generates a snug and comfortable fit
It also helps one have a better feel of the ground
Several users praise this Adidas golf shoe for its high-top construction
The ankle sleeve is extremely flexible, and it feels amazing on the ankles
Numerous testers say that the dial is a cool technology
Not only does it make the trainer easy to get on and off, but it also keeps the foot locked in
The waterproof upper keeps the interior dry, according to a few individuals
Some athletes applaud the brand for creating a product that gives stability during the entire swing
A handful of users are fans of the tread design because it possesses a fantastic grip
cons: One doesn't recommend using this product during summer as it may get too warm
Another person notes that the product could be improved by adding arch support

customer_reviews.text: These are great feeling golf shoes. Probably some of the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever had not just golf shoes. My feet felt great even after walking 36 holes. I bought them after seeing the codechaos won mygolfspys most wanted spikeless shoe testing and wanting something with better traction than my old puma spikeless shoes. So far they’ve worked and felt great. Hopefully they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Pleaseant Surprise
customer_reviews.text: First impressions, meaning I havent played in them yet. I have had Adidas golf shoes in the past. These are the most comfortable pair of Adidas I have tried on. Which was unexpected because They are not known for having very cushioned shoes. I like the nontraditonal look of them. I have high hopes for the Boa System. Wearing around the house I like how snug the shoe feels with the Boa System. will update if there anything new to report when I play in them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Probably the most comfortable and convenient golf shoe I have worn. I just couldn’t get over the high top sock look in shorts. Just not for me. If they were just like the lace version but with the boa, they would be THE perfect golf shoe
customer_reviews.author: zach dunn

customer_reviews.title: Opening for foot is to small, struggled to get on.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the concept but poorly executed. Whats the point in making it easier to lace up if you make it harder to get your foot into the shoe to begin with? Mine came in a repackaged box and was clearly worn to the point they didn't bother to clean out the mud in the spikes. The forefoot seems thin on support, I just feel the ball of my foot is right next to the ground with hardly any cushion in between. Love Adidas bounce shoes (5) but this one needs more engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Carooch

customer_reviews.title: Amazing comfort. Fits like a sock! No blisters!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is awesome! I was constantly getting blisters in almost any pair of golf shoes I was buying... Tried a few pairs out until I found these.. I have a pair of NB shoes for walking with the similar sock fit and wished they had a shoe like that for golf.. this is it.. if I wasn't convinced my first round with them, I was when we had cart path round only during a brutal hot day in central florida... These things honestly didn't even feel like I walked at all. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: A golf shoe that feels like a basketball shoe, but performs like a golf shoe
customer_reviews.text: It’s like walking in a cloud on the golf course. Great grip. Maximum comfort. Maximum swagger.
customer_reviews.author: John Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I walk a 9 hole course multiple times in a day. I average about 11.5 miles each day. I recently had footjoys, and they were just fine... but that's absolutely it. When I put these shoes on... it was like I had been wearing them for forever! Instant like a glove feeling, and the balance when hitting drives... just freaking awesome! If you want the best shoes money can buy in golf... get these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny MN

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Fit like a glove! Easy to clean! Look great!
customer_reviews.author: Leviathan55

customer_reviews.title: Will be a repeat buyer❗️
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t use them for golfing - I use those shoes when I walk along the babbling brooks in the state of Vermont - they’re waterproof and you can walk through a stream and your feet stay dry - but don’t get too deep 🌊💦💧
customer_reviews.author: Gary Dzyak

customer_reviews.title: Best golf shoes on 2020
customer_reviews.text: If you have a wide fit, half size up and most comfortable golf shoes in the market. +++++
customer_reviews.author: David Kim

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy and great show, not as water resistant as stated
customer_reviews.text: Great show and super comfortable. Says water resistant but in the morning where there is "dew" water sneaks in from the bottom somewhere or thru the material... Bit of soggy foot golf.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Kim

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and alsome design. I stronglry recommand this item.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Took these out on a very rainy, hot day and loved how comfortable they were. For spikeless they were not bad at all in very soggy conditions. Good traction all around.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: A Must buy
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the most comfortable shoes I have ever played in. They look and feel great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great look, great feel and all around happy with the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: trent buckingham

customer_reviews.title: Best golf shoes
customer_reviews.text: Husband says best golf shoes he’s ever bought. Shoes have great support and unique tighten up ability over tie shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, just picky
customer_reviews.text: I got these through the prime wardrobe option to see how they feel and look. I love the knit part that gives the shoe more of a mid top style. The BOA system is awesome at helping you dial in the tightness of the shoe. My only woe, because I am very picky, is that the shoe was a little too pointy for me. Unfortunately, I couldn’t take these on the course to try them out, but I wouldn’t doubt the soles would keep you grounded well. Sizing wise; every adidas shoe I own, I have to go down a half size for a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes for COLD weather
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing, super comfortable with great traction for a spikeless shoe. However, they seem geared toward off-season golfing, not summer golfing. Upon checking the Adidas website, I noticed they advertise these as made for "wintry" conditions. I'd love for these to be my go-to spikeless shoes, but they keep my feet too hot, so I'm sticking with the regular Codechaos.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Goshko II

product_meta.title: adidas mens EPC16 Codechaos Boa
feature_bullets: Textile base with adidas Primeknit textile Collar
Our new Chaos TRAXION outsole, a Kurim grip hybrid spikeless shoe built with durable Adiwear
